audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing a demonstration of adding overlay images and video clips to an interview in Movie Maker, explaining the technique of showing images related to the interview subject's speech, and then returning to the interview. He states that it's a standard technique in editing interviews but a little difficult to do in Movie Maker and mentions needing to work around some things. He mentions starting with a project and explains having saved the original project, and then makes a copy for working on the overlays. He then says that the new copy will be edited, and the original is safe. He mentions deleting content.

The clip begins with a male speaker who summarizes the previous action, stating they now have the clip of interest saved in an overlay project. He then states he will export just the audio. After a brief pause, the speaker states it might be a good idea to check that it worked properly. Subsequently, electronic music begins, and the speaker adds to say that he is going to find the audio that he just exported and add it into the project. The speaker notes there is a gap at the start of the music, and it will need to be fixed later. The speaker indicates that he is happy with it for now.

The clip begins with a male speaker stating that he will delete something and specifies that he is interested in the part of the interview that takes place "around about from here". A female speaker then begins talking about "utilizing local sun, wind", followed by the male speaker clarifying that she begins talking about sun, wind, and rain harvesting. He further says that she moves on to talking about city parks and that he wants some clips to be shown.

The clip begins with one male speaker discussing editing, mentioning he's going to "split this clip at that point," and "delete this bit," while emphasizing the importance of a "duration" number. He then affirms this is "okay." Subsequently, instrumental music, perhaps suited for suspenseful or intense scenes, takes over. The audio features an ominous and mysterious tone.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker instructing someone to navigate to a home screen, add music, and overlay a project. He then notes that things aren't lining up properly, and the audio is slightly out of sync. The male speaker then mentions he will zoom in as far as possible, put the play head at the start of the audio, go to edit, then options, then set the start point. Another speaker is heard; she appears to be reading text which includes the phrase "Eco City should enable the residents to live." The male speaker then judges that the clip will be good enough for their purposes. The clip concludes with what sounds like background music, which can be categorized as generic elevator music.

The audio features a single male speaker explaining how to replace a section of a timeline with images, mentioning that the section is "a bit that we want to replace with images," and has a specific duration of "18 seconds, 18.83 seconds." He plans to select the section in the timeline, zoom out, and delete it. Following this, he intends to add photos to the project.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing how he has found photos relating to what someone is talking about and mentions he has one of a city park, solar house and a wind turbine, totaling four images. He then states he pulled them into a project and will make sure the length is the same length as the piece they were removed from. A female voice then speaks of "a good quality of life while using minimal natural resources". This is followed by music.

The audio clip begins with a female speaker, in a calm, informative tone, describing the elements of a model, including "local materials," "local sun, wind, and rainfall," and incorporating "natural ecosystems into urban areas." Following this, a male speaker interjects in a slightly critical tone. He states "that's all fine," but expresses that a "city park needs to come last in the sequence."

The audio clip features a male speaker who is explaining something, referencing "dragging it to where I want it." He notes there's "a little bit, a little bit of an echo" due to the presence of two clips. His tone seems informative.

The clip starts with a male speaker explaining that he's going to "split" a "soundtrack clip" at two points, specifying he's splitting it where "it comes in and out," seemingly referring to the soundtrack. He speaks in a neutral, instructional tone. This is followed by a short burst of static noise, then a brief period of silence.

The clip begins with a female speaker describing a model that incorporates local materials and services to urban areas to provide something. Subsequently, a male speaker begins talking about movie making and adding overlay images. He mentions, "So with a bit of faffing about, it is possible to do overlay images on a...on an interview in Movie Maker," and then outlines a plan to save the movie, naming it "overlay done." After this exportation, he intends to replace the original clip with the new one containing the overlay images.
